title: [Large-Scale] Language-Centered E-Learning Design Thinking Workshop for Sustainability

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, general understanding of environmental issues, intermediate language proficiency (reading, writing, vocabulary)
context.additional_context: Program to strengthen e-learning content development capabilities integrating language domains (environmental terminology learning and discourse analysis) with sustainability.

learning_goals: Learners connect core concepts of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to language activities (vocabulary analysis, text reconstruction, etc.) for explanation.
Learners use the design thinking process to create an e-learning activity prototype reflecting the language learning needs of a target audience.
Learners plan and implement interactive language learning content (including reading/writing activities) using digital tools (Mentimeter, Miro, etc.).

resources: Open Educational Resources (OER) related to SDGs

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
